subject: Re: [junit] How to enable junitreport in ANT?
msgSnippet: Hello dear Mr. Rabbit, ... This probably isn t JUnit s problem. What s your classpath? What solutions that you already have tried have failed? Is a jaxp- or
messageBody:
Hello dear Mr. Rabbit,


Am Dienstag, 2. April 2002 08:32 schrieb rabbitxu60:
> Hello all:
> I want to junitreport in build.xml of ANT.I got the following error
> when I us junitreport.
>
> <target name="runtests" depends="compiletests"
> description="Execute Unit Tests">
> <junit printsummary="yes" fork="yes" haltonfailure="yes">
> <classpath refid="compile.classpath"/>
> <formatter type="xml" />
> <test name="com.mytest.test" />
> </junit>
>
> <junitreport>
> <fileset dir=".">
> <include name="TEST-*.xml"/>
> </fileset>
> <report format="noframes" styledir="."/>
> </junitreport>
>
> </target>
>
> build.xml:171: Errors while applying transformations
>
> whether need other jar?I don't know how to configure?
>
> please help me!
> Thank you!

This "probably" isn't JUnit's problem.

What's your classpath? What solutions that you already have tried have
failed? Is a jaxp- or trax-compliant XSLT Processor like saxon or xalan in
your classpath resp. ANT's lib directory?


Greetings

--
Christian Wolfgang Hujer
Geschäftsführender Gesellschafter
